subject: RE: [junit] java.beans.XMLEncoder with swing GUI JUnit
msgSnippet: Sorry. The test I had pasted in my previous mail should have been this (with XMLEncoder rather than WOXMLEncoder). import junit.framework.TestCase; import
messageBody:
Sorry.

The test I had pasted in my previous mail should have been this (with
XMLEncoder rather than WOXMLEncoder).

import junit.framework.TestCase;
import junit.framework.Test;
import junit.framework.TestSuite;

import java.io.*;
import java.beans.XMLEncoder;
import java.beans.XMLDecoder;

public class XMLEncoderTest extends TestCase {

public XMLEncoderTest(String name) {
super(name);
}

protected void setUp() {
}

protected void tearDown() {
}

public static Test suite() {
return new TestSuite(XMLEncoderTest.class);
}

public void testSpiking() {
try {
MyClass myObject = new MyClass();
myObject.setName("Max");
myObject.setValue(0.001);

String xmlFileName = System.getProperty("user.dir")+
"/"+"Sample.xml";
System.out.println("xmlFileName="+xmlFileName);
XMLEncoder encoder = new XMLEncoder(
new BufferedOutputStream(
new FileOutputStream(xmlFileName)));
encoder.writeObject(myObject);
encoder.close();

XMLDecoder decoder = new XMLDecoder(
new BufferedInputStream(
new FileInputStream(xmlFileName)));
MyClass myReadObject = (MyClass)decoder.readObject();
decoder.close();

assertEquals("Name", "Max", myReadObject.getName());
assertEquals("Name", 0.001, myReadObject.getValue(), 0.0);
} catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
fail("FileNotFoundException should not be thrown here.\n"+e);
}
}
}

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Morten Grum, PH-Consult [mailto:mg@...]
> Sent: 13. januar 2003 12:24
> To: JunitList
> Subject: [junit] java.beans.XMLEncoder with swing GUI JUnit
>
>
> Hi All!
>
> I have a problem with java.beans.XMLEncoder that only occures when my test
> is run in the swing GUI JUnit and not when I run through ant.
>
> My XMLEncoder test runs fine when I run it via ant. But when I
> run it using
> the swing gui (running from within idea) it comes up with the
> stack overflow
> error below. Normally my tests run fine in both ways.
>
> Details below. Any ideas?
>
> Thanks in advance.
>
> Morten
